title: Calories in a Shot of Whiskey
meta_description: Discover whiskey calories in a shot, including full nutrition breakdown, equivalents, and tweaks for different proofs or mixers.
h1: Calories in a Shot of Whiskey
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) shot of 80-proof (40% ABV) whiskey, straight/neat, no mixers or ice.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any additions; alcohol content affects calorie density. Consult labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard shot of 80-proof whiskey contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add cola mixer (4 oz per shot)
Bourbon vs. scotch (slight flavor difference, similar calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of whiskey?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for a 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof whiskey.

faqs.q: Does whiskey have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Straight whiskey has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: What affects whiskey calories in a shot?
faqs.a: Proof (higher ABV increases calories), shot size, and mixers like soda or juice.
Yes, straight shots are 0 g net carbs, but avoid sugary mixers.

faqs.q: How does proof change calories in whiskey?
faqs.a: Each 10-proof increase adds about 12 kcal per shot; 80-proof is standard at 97 kcal.
